Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we know the blockhash for 1000000 and 1000010, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we can get the headers for all the blocks between them and make sure they connect backwards to the prior block and that 1000010 matches

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now we know we have valid notarized headers for those 11 blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the utxo at height 1000005 gets a merkle txproof to show it is part of the merkleroot of 1000005

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which is in the header that was between notarizations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the key here is that each header has the previous blockhash

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you can link backwards and verify that a specific segment between 1000000 and 1000010 are all valid, without any other data

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Its like u were born to do this JL,  its basically a normal day for u to find something what nobody did before

Author: Markus#5464
Content: I dont see how other projects will ever catch up in this speed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i just had a hard time reading the flyclient paper... too much math, too many attack vectors to deal with

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i trust they do just fine, but i realized in a flash that using notarized data, we avoid 99%+ of the issues, and dont need 99.9%+ of the data

Author: Markus#5464
Content: thats efficiency  right there

Author: Markus#5464
Content: dont make it harder then it have to be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: exactly!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: validate the segment of the blockchain that notarized the utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if you have many utxo, if they are clumped within the same segment, there is no need to get the same data again

Content: kmd chart following and respecting fibonacci like it was meant to be

Author: FBTroy#9693
Content: @jl777c Could this break through with the nSPV node ever lead to a automatic claim function in a wallet, or does requiring a manual claim periodically have nothing to do with managing the size and speed? I wish I could just put my KMD into a wallet and check back to monitor the power of compounding.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: requiring a manual claim has nothing to do with nSPV

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you didnt have to do anything, then you wouldnt be very active

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the idea is to reward active users

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not to make it fully automatic

Author: FBTroy#9693
Content: Ok, I see, I thought it was contributing in some way just by being staked.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it isnt staking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all utxo >= 10 are accruing rewards for up to a month,not just the ones with enough to stake a block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are only 1440 * 30 blocks in a month, if to require staking a block to collect like most other coins with rewards, it would skew things toward the larger balances

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as it is it is possible for literally 10 million people to be accruing rewards in the same month

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but that would require 10 million people to all have 10 KMD

Author: FBTroy#9693
Content: I am not very technical, so I appreciate the explanation.

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Are rewards based on time/date when they are recieved in the wallet? Also does month end from day they are recieved in the wallet or by end of month by calendar?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the seconds are counted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 31 days worth of seconds is the limit

Author: Markus#5464
Content: Ok

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: rounded to nearest minute, minus one hour
